text:
A Night at the Tavern

A dim tavern, three men present.  
A drunken man hums a tune.  
Drunk Man: “His wife a year he fondly loved...”  

---

The stout man stirs, waking up.  
Stout Man: “What nonsense is this?”  
Silent Companion: *glares with mistrust at him.*  

---

A retired clerk watches, anxious.  
Retired Clerk: “What a strange gathering...”  
*He sips nervously, scanning the room.*

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov observes a drunken man in a tavern, highlighting the contrasting emotions and social dynamics present in the scene.
